TEXT.TITLE: U.K. MONEY RATES HARDEN ON LAWSON CURRENCY TARGETS
TEXT.BODY: Money market rates rates showed a harder edge after news U.K. Chancellor of the Exchequer Nigel Lawson has set a target for the pound against the mark and dollar, to be maintained by a mixture of interest rates and intervention in the foreign exchange markets. Dealers said the market was surprised by the Chancellor's disclosure of sterling target rates, around 2.90 marks and 1.60 dlrs, and nervous over the implications for domestic interest rates, further reducing the propects for a near term cut in U.K. Bank base rates. The key three months interbank sterling rate gained 1/16 point at 10 9-7/8 pct. The pound opened three basis points lower at 71.3 in trade weighted terms, at around 1.59 dlrs and 2.91 marks. REUTER
